official_title: To amend the Social Security Act to provide for the reform of regulations governing the reimbursement of physicians under Medicare Part B.
short_title: Medicare Physician Regulatory Reform Amendments of 1990

summary.text: Medicare Physician Regulatory Reform Amendments of 1990 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to require carriers and peer review organizations to release the medical review screen or the associated screening parameter to a physician before notifying such physician that payment for his or her service has been denied. Allows a medical society or other professional organization representing physicians to represent a group or class of physicians in Medicare payment determinations, reconsiderations, or appeals. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to appoint, based on nominations submitted by national medical organizations representing physicians, a Physicians Advisory Council with which the Secretary must consult concerning changes in the Medicare program and proposed changes in regulations and carrier operation policies.

titles.title: Medicare Physician Regulatory Reform Amendments of 1990
To amend the Social Security Act to provide for the reform of regulations governing the reimbursement of physicians under Medicare Part B.
